tool.name: BuildAndSymbolize

param.name: quad
param.dialogReference: A polygon feature class of the map boundary. I used a shapefile for testing.

param.name: layer
param.dialogReference: A reference layer that has the symbology you want. NOTE THIS AND THE INPUT DATA MUST SHARE THE ATTRIBUTE THAT THE SYMBOLOGY IS BASED ON.

param.name: polys
param.dialogReference: A feature class of all polygons built.

param.name: selectPolys
param.dialogReference: A feature class with just those polygons within the map boundary.

param.name: layerOut
param.dialogReference: A layer file of the map with the symbology matched to the reference layer. NOTE YOU MUST SAVE THIS AS A LAYER FILE (i.e. .lyr) NOT A FEATURE CLASS WHICH IS THE DEFAULT.

tool.summary: This tool builds map polygons using input lines, a quad boundary, and label points. The quad boundary is treated the same as any line in the input lines (e.g. contacts and faults). The created polygons within the quad boundary are then exported and symbolized in the same manner as in a reference layer.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: This tool builds map polygons using input lines, a quad boundary, and label points. The quad boundary is treated the same as any line in the input lines (e.g. contacts and faults). The created polygons within the quad boundary are then exported and symbolized in the same manner as in a reference layer.
